decade on Thursday, handing the reins of the company to one of its co-founders in an effort to rediscover its start-up roots," Claire Cain Miller and Miguel Helft report for The New York Times. As it has grown into the dominant company in Silicon Valley, Google has lost some of its entrepreneurial culture and become a slower-moving bureaucracy, analysts and insiders say, Miller and Helft report.
